website_summaries.verdict: A simple spare tire carrier that's easy to use and easy on your budget.
pros: Fits 8-15 inch tires with 4- or 5-lug rims
Made of zinc-plated steel to resist rust and corrosion
Easy to install and remove when you need to access spare tire
cons: It may be too small for some trailer frames

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for me on my 20.5 x 8-10 tire with a 4.5 bolt circle wheel. Holds my pontoon boat trailer spare just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Marrco

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, simple mount that slides on the trailer frame
customer_reviews.text: The price is great. It's a simple solution. The only downfall is that it slides forward & back on the trailer frame. When it slides forward the tire interferes with the winch handle. When it slide back the tire rubs on the boat hull. I tightened it to the point where the U bolt starts to deform & I don't want to bend the rim of the wheel. Maybe inner surface of the U bolt needs to be rough to prevent sliding.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tire holder
customer_reviews.text: This works quite well to hold a 13" wheel and tire under my watercraft trailer. Very inexpensive and effective option to store spare. And also got it out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorMasterBlaster

customer_reviews.title: Incredible disapointment
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly...incredibly...this item arrived and is absolutely useless right out of the package. THE NUTS WILL NOT THREAD ONTO THE BOLTS! Yes I yelled that sentence. This spare tire carrier cannot be installed because the nuts do not match the threads of the bolts. It has NO security as THE NUTS CANNOT BE THREADED ONTO THE BOLTS! Therefor the value for my money is $ZERO...Do not buy...I am 58 years old boat owner. I KMOW when nuts will not THREAD onto a bolt. Oh...yes, it is MADE IN CHINA!!!
customer_reviews.author: DENNY BOY'S

customer_reviews.title: Spare tire security
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a new trailer and needed a way to mount a spare tire on the trailer. I welded a piece of channel iron on the right side in front of the right wheel and welded the U bolt to the channel iron an dosed a lock on one mounting lug nut and also added a chain through to the wheel and around the tire to the metal frame of the trailer. This mount was a lot cheaper than the pre made mount and the tire is closer to the body of the trailer. Build your own mount with this u-bolt . I recommend for the DIY person.
customer_reviews.author: Raube

customer_reviews.title: Mount
customer_reviews.text: Worked on my 5x8 utility trailer. I had to cut more threads farther down cause of the tube size my trailer is made out of. Once I got the spare tight I marked and cut off about 4 inches of excess bolt to keep from getting caught on anything.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Large, Heavy Duty U Bolt
customer_reviews.text: It was extremely heavy and the threads could go deeper. I ended up putting a block of wood behind the metal cross piece I was mounting to. This wood block allowed the threads to extend out so that wheel nuts could be threaded on.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Family

customer_reviews.title: very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to mount a full sized spare tire on the font bar of my trailer. works really well, very pleased for this simple purchase. I could have mounted anywhere around the outside frame of the trailer but chose the front to put weight on the tongue, it tows smoother with a bit of weight up front. Super nice that the nuts were included.
customer_reviews.author: tomasa

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: This is a very basic spare tire holder. Can be a little challenging to hold the tire up, the bracket and screw on a bolt. All and all, it gets the job done. Update: 6/20/16: For my boat trailer it was very challenging finding a location to use this, but I did. It's not the best tire carrier option, but I guess we can come to that conclusion w/it's $11 price tag. I will probably upgrade to a sturdier spare tire carrier before too long. I dropped the rating to 3 star as it really is just OK.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Add a spare to your trailer for cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Used it attach a spare tire to my boat trailer front bow post. I had to add a wood spacer to make it tight enough to prevent the spare from moving going down the post while driving
customer_reviews.author: Patrick R. Drake

customer_reviews.title: This is the right tool for spare trailer tire!
customer_reviews.text: I knew people use U bolts to attach spare tires onto trailers, but I took the wrong path initially. I went to the orange big box store and bought a 7" U bolt (longest they have), but it turned out it was still too short. Searched online and found this one at less than $10 including two bolts. No complaint.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Great price and works wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: Saved us. We have blown 3 boat trailer tires and kept forgetting our spare. Got this and it attached perfectly to the trailer. Hopefully, no more flats, but we have our tire if it happens. Great price and works wonderfully. Can use as a side mount or face up.
customer_reviews.author: Audra - Indianapolis

customer_reviews.title: Simple solution for adding a spare on trailer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Great addition to the pwc trailer. As for as security, it’s secure on the trailer but easily taken off by someone who wants to steal a spare
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: attached spare to the rear bumper of camper and holds much better then the tie down straps. feels very secure. ill be buying more. Really affordable. remember to stock the correct wrench on you trailer. some lug wrenches arent deep enough.
customer_reviews.author: SMB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and good price.
customer_reviews.text: Used on my boat trailer. Easy setup. Secured with cable lock from Amazon. Will test it out going to Florida in Feb.
customer_reviews.author: tomr

customer_reviews.title: Very simple very effective easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Very simple and effective and it does fit a 6 hole wheel as shown in the photograph.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Guisbert

customer_reviews.title: Great value, economical way to secure a trailer tire.
customer_reviews.text: Great value, economical way to secure a trailer tire, arrived very fast.
customer_reviews.author: MEC

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had to force it on 4 bolt pattern 12x4.80 but it worked
customer_reviews.author: Mark Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Simple and perfect fix!
customer_reviews.text: Simple but perfect. Fit our 2013 magic tilt trailer perfectly. Adds the spare to the front of the trailer vice having it on the side in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Chris and Trish

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to attach a spare tire
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple and straight forward. This made attaching a spare tire lying flat on the tongue of the trailer a breeze. It would have worked fine in a vertical position too, but we wanted to keep the wheel higher away from the ground. Some spacers will keep you from having to screw the nuts down so far if you have lots of thread throwing.
customer_reviews.author: Dan H

customer_reviews.title: Spare Tire Mount
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. The reason for the low rating on security, you need to purchase a lock designed for that type mount. I knew that when I bought it. Recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As described...
customer_reviews.text: This did not fit the boat trailer I ordered it for but it did fit the pontoon trailer like a champ.. I did not measure the wheels before I ordered the mount...Strictly my fault... So I kept it for the toon... It was exactly as described...
customer_reviews.author: Rick D.

customer_reviews.title: what a piece of junk, no bolts or nuts ...
customer_reviews.text: what a piece of junk,no bolts or nuts .and if you did have a lock by and used it by the instructions it wouldn't work any way what a darn joke
customer_reviews.author: Larry Bahr

customer_reviews.title: Simple, but adequate
customer_reviews.text: Fits like a glove. Simple, but gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Spare tire carrier would not fit
customer_reviews.text: The spare tire carrier would not work with the trailer tire on my utility trailer. The threads were not deep enough to allow the tire to be drawn against the trailer tongue. In addition the long overall length of the carrier made fitting the tire onto the carrier difficult. I had to modify the carrier in order to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 3 inch trailer neck and my 8inch 5 lug rim for a snowmobile trailer.
customer_reviews.author: dakota

customer_reviews.title: Easy & inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Used this to mount a spare tire on my tow dolly. Works like a charm and didn't cost a bundle.
customer_reviews.author: ronald spurgeon

customer_reviews.title: Too big for a trailer tire
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with a small trailer tire. The rim isn't very deep so this turned out to be too long. I could have cut off the excess, but the threads didn't go down far enough to hold tight against the rim. Submitted request for refund and got my money back.
customer_reviews.author: D. Enerson

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: This mount was easy to install and I now carry a spare tire on my new utility trailer. No need for a fancy mount, this one works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse R.

customer_reviews.title: Good value and gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this product before and will probably purchase it again. I build small trailers for recreational hovercraft and these are the least expensive solution I have found for mounting a spare tire to the trailer frame. They just work very well for 8, 10 and 12" tires and small utility trailers.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: It does what it was made to do
customer_reviews.text: The product does what it what built to do. Secure a spare tire.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Simple clever design.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and simple design made a perfect choice for trailer's spare wheel. Don't need security in the area I live and the 2 nuts are doing a good job holding it in place. I'll buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Marian L.

customer_reviews.title: Received as advertised. Fit perfectly with my 4 lug ...
customer_reviews.text: Received as advertised. Fit perfectly with my 4 lug motorcycle trailer wheels. Fit right over the trailer frame with no modifications necessary. Bolts are a bit long but I used old sockets for spacers to take up the slack so wheels would fit snuggly up under my trailer. The offset of the bolts makes for a snug fit around trailer frame.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Universal Fitment Requires Spacer.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is for universal fit for up to 3" square trailer tongues. For that reason engineered a complex spacer to hold the carrier solidly on my 2" tongue to the tire. Ends were too long for my application so they were shortened. It's working well, with the necessary modifications.
customer_reviews.author: JustAnOldGuy

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive means to hold spare tire.
customer_reviews.text: Because of the boat and trailer, I am restricted in how I can attach a spare tire to the trailer. This is a very inexpensive means to hold the tire onto the trailer and allowed me to position the spare the only place it would fit. It looks quality and with a little tweaking should fit most any spare tire. Overall an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. ROBBINS

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, but I did have to cut ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, but I did have to cut off the extra threads to keep them from snagging things. BTW - make sure you have the nuts tightened down and THEN cut off the excess. You can "back off" the nuts to make sure the threads remain viable.
customer_reviews.author: Bid D

customer_reviews.title: Could be fine
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find a place on my trailer where I had enough room to use this. I'd have to move my trailer jack farther up the tongue in order to install this, but I put the jack where it is for a reason. That doesn't make it a bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Sniatkowski

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be of pretty good quality and worked great on 5 lug spare.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It holds our spare tire nicely. It fits on a larger than advertised wheel
customer_reviews.text: It holds our spare tire nicely. It fits on a larger than advertised wheel. It hasn't shown any signs of rust yet , but at this price i will just paint it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Hoffman Sr

customer_reviews.title: Simple and it works
customer_reviews.text: The price I got it for On Amazon was unbeatable and was surprised how easy it was to install. It took about 2 minutes. I would just make sure that it is the right width and depth for your trailer. I would also make sure you get the right bolt pattern of the rim and tire your mounting to so it fits properly. I mounted mine on the beam of the trailer tounge and worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Missy jost

customer_reviews.title: Don't take Amazons suggestion here
customer_reviews.text: Economy in this case really means economy. The way it fits you can't add a lock even though Amazon will suggest one (that doesn't fit). Spend another $10-15 and buy a real spare tire braket.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: simple solution for spare mounting
customer_reviews.text: used this to mount my spare tire up under the bow of the boat. you can't beat the simplicity. just make sure that you have a wrench or large enough pliers to remove the nuts cause they will most likely be too low to use a lug wrench or socket. wouldn't want to find that out on the side of the highway...
customer_reviews.author: b02

customer_reviews.title: Simple is sometimes better
customer_reviews.text: If you have a trailer, you need a spare. First go buy a spare, then figure out where your going to store it on your trip. I used this simple carrier to store the spare under the trailer. Hung the U-bolt straight down from a frame rail. You could also drill a couple of holes in the trailer deck and hang it where ever you wish. A little work to get the spare up under there, but it's out of the way and I have peace of mind. Make sure you have a jack and a lug wrench or socket also. Don't let a flat ruin your trip.
customer_reviews.author: Snwjnky

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to attach a spare to my two wheel master tow dolly. My dolly, unlike many others came with surge brakes and the yolk is extended pretty far so I can't mount it. When I try to mount it close to the dolly and further from the car, the tire sits too low and rubs....no biggie since it was only like $13 I think...but now you've been warned.
customer_reviews.author: quanaman

customer_reviews.title: Nice bracket
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. No issues. I have bought a couple of these over the years the only negative is the plating does not hold up well. I would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Simple, cheap price, works as it needs to ...
customer_reviews.text: Simple, cheap price, works as it needs to. Used on the tongue of a Northern Tool/Harbor freight style folding trailer.
customer_reviews.author: highwaydevil

customer_reviews.title: Survived the Alcan Highway
customer_reviews.text: Made it up the alcan....even after a tongue break and being dragged down the highway. At least I didn't lose my spare tire. I ended up having to use them upside down (wheel hanging horizontal under tongue). Excellent quality for cost. Expect to use these for years, on multiple trailers.
customer_reviews.author: AK Phil

customer_reviews.title: My husband was very pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Just as described. My husband was very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Cuthbertson

customer_reviews.title: basic product basic price
customer_reviews.text: As simple as it gets, Got this because I did not need or want a fancy arm mounted carrier. This fits the bill
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: ... works but i bought a frame mount that i like much better also from
customer_reviews.text: it works but i bought a frame mount that i like much better also from amazon

customer_reviews.title: Good buy !!!
customer_reviews.text: The product works fine and very easy to mount the spare tire to my trailer'

customer_reviews.title: Use for trailer wheels
customer_reviews.text: Could have been a bit longer and not as curved

customer_reviews.title: Great simple carrier at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the simplicity of this carrier, and the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Galbraith

customer_reviews.title: a nice holder for a spare tire
customer_reviews.text: Had to play around with it to marry up to the rim holes, but work as intened; and for the price, a nice holder for a spare tire.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Aquilia

customer_reviews.title: It works great.
customer_reviews.text: Used it to mount spare tire on my boat trailer. It works great.

customer_reviews.title: Too short
customer_reviews.text: It's too short - need to be a 1/2 inch longer minimum.

customer_reviews.text: It was supposed to fit my 15" 5 lug wheel....DIDN'T.... and was sent without lug nuts. I wanted to like it...Just didnt work out this time
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Works as needed.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't able to use this on my boat trailer due to frame design so I had to return. I have one on my jetski trailer that works great with no issues. Just check trailer measurements before ordering.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Needed a bit of tweaking to fit the bolt pattern of my wheels. (4 on 4.5)

customer_reviews.title: ... else can I say it's very secure cheap and easy to
customer_reviews.text: Spare tire is attached to the trailer what else can I say it's very secure cheap and easy to use

customer_reviews.text: Pretty basic attachment - get the one with the lock(ing) attachment for a few bucks more .

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. I had to do a little modifying during installation as my trailer is a utility vehicle.

customer_reviews.text: This is an easy way to mount a spare tire to your trailer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and economical
customer_reviews.text: The easiest way to quickly mount a spare tire. I have a 5 lug trailer tire for my boat and this mounted the spare in less than a minute.

customer_reviews.title: This works great, can put it a couple different ways if ...
customer_reviews.text: This works great, can put it a couple different ways if I would like to, my boyfriend is very happy with it. This is well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, works as intended.  Affordable.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Holds the spare on the trailer without any issues. I don't forsee any problems. Affordable and sold by Amazon. Win - Win

customer_reviews.title: Works very well especially for price
customer_reviews.text: simple,uncomplicated,holds tire securely. does a great job especially for the price

customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, great price and would recommend to anyone needing a way to get a spare tire attached to trailer.

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price, but would be much better if galvanized!
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price, but would be much better if galvanized!

customer_reviews.title: Bracket shipped to me quickly and bracket was very sturdy. Installed in minutes and will see how it ...
customer_reviews.text: Received bracket today for my boat trailer. Reading reviews I was nervous it might not be as durable as I needed. Bracket shipped to me quickly and bracket was very sturdy. Installed in minutes and will see how it stands up to water when pulling trailer in and out of water. Very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: simple, easy and safe. It keeps my spare tires out of the way and I never have to remember to bring them. I used this on three different trailer/tire combos without any size or compatibility issues.
customer_reviews.author: R. Greco

customer_reviews.title: Good low price option to mount spare tire
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to mount a spare tire to my boat trailer. Installation was easy and it holds the spare tire very securely in place.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap... and it worked ok
customer_reviews.text: Had to bend it a little to fit the lug holes but fit the price it works pretty good.

customer_reviews.text: Sucks, says fits 5 lug wheel was so tight it rolled threads putting tire on, so nuts were cross threading when trying to tighten. had to cut it off.

customer_reviews.text: Great low cost way to carry a spare. Works well

customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and quality. Works well and easy to install. Dimensions given by other reviewers were pretty accurate. Holds spare to my trailer quite well. I think the size will work for most tires and trailers.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time, and as advertised. A little ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, and as advertised. A little more lightly -built than I was hoping for-- not for a heavy spare.

customer_reviews.text: This spare tire carrier is well made , does the job and is fairly priced. I highly recommend it to anyone with a trailer.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for 14 inch spare on my single-axle boat trailer
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for my 14 inch spare on my single-axle boat trailer. Solved the problem cost-effectively.
customer_reviews.author: I Love Amazons

customer_reviews.title: My Spare Tire Carrier
customer_reviews.text: This help me to install my trailer's spare tire between the rails and holds in a safe place, so I have a spare tire for my trailer anywhere I go.

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes the easiest solution really is the best
customer_reviews.text: So simple even a caveman could use it. Why pay more?

customer_reviews.title: Simple and cost effective
customer_reviews.text: Using on a high profile trailer tire on a 15" rim attaching to my boat trailer. Works great. Seems sturdier than the Shoreline marine one.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good for what I wanted for! Now I can keep the spare tire on the trailer.

customer_reviews.title: Worked out well for me. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: I added it to my boat trailer and it worked fine. Great price, but for some set ups the tire may sit too low on the trailer.

customer_reviews.title: Too long for a lightweight traler.
customer_reviews.text: This was too long for a 12 trailer wheel on a 3x3 trailer support so it wouldn't tighten all the way.

product_meta.title: Fulton ETC 0101 Economy Spare Tire Carrier
feature_bullets: Fits 8", 9", 12", 13", 14", and 15" Wheels with 4 or 5 lug rims
Includes lug nuts to secure wheel to frame
